name: Product Ownership
description: Own, evolve and communicate the vision, and guide the evolution of the product to achieve the vision.

activitySpaces.name: Explore Possibilities
activitySpaces.description: Explore the possibilities presented by the creation of a new or improved software system. This includes the analysis of the opportunity to be addressed and the identification of the stakeholders. Explore possibilities to: Enable the right stakeholders to be involved, Understand the stakeholders’ needs, Identify opportunities for the use of the software system, Understand why the software system is needed, Establish the value offered by the software system.

activities.name: Evolve the Product Vision
activities.description: Agree and communicate the goals and return-on-investment case for the product to drive and inform ongoing decisions about the product.

activitySpaces.name: Understand Stakeholder Needs
activitySpaces.description: Engage with the stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure that the right results are produced. This includes identifying and working with the stakeholder representatives to progress the opportunity. Understand stakeholder needs to: Ensure the right solution is created, Align expectations, Collect feedback and generate input, Ensure that the solution produced provides benefit to the stakeholders.

activities.name: Build Stakeholder Network
activities.description: Actively engage all stakeholders with a legitimate and material interest in the endeavor, including eliciting feedback and negotiating compromises as required.

activities.name: Demonstrate the Product
activities.description: Show the evolving product to stakeholders and elicit feedback as frequently as possible to converge on an optimal solution.

activitySpaces.name: Ensure Stakeholder Satisfaction
activitySpaces.description: Share the results of the development work with the stakeholders to gain their acceptance of the system produced and verify that the opportunity has been successfully addressed. Ensure the satisfaction of the stakeholders to: Get approval for the deployment of the system, Validate that the system is of benefit to the stakeholders, Validate that the system is acceptable to the stakeholders, Independently verify that the system delivered is the one required, Confirm the expected benefit that the system will provide.

activities.name: Achieve Acceptance
activities.description: The product is accepted for release. Progressively accepting the product enables frequent releases to be made to maximize return-on-investment.

alphas.name: Stakeholders
alphas.description: The people, groups, or organizations who affect or are affected by a software system. The stakeholders provide the opportunity, and are the source of the requirements for the software system. They are involved throughout the software engineering endeavor to support the team and ensure that an acceptable software system is produced.

workProducts.name: Stakeholder Network
workProducts.description: Who the stakeholder representatives are, and how we will engage with them throughout the endeavor.

states.name: Recognized
states.description: Stakeholders have been identified.

states.name: Represented
states.description: The mechanisms for involving the stakeholders are agreed and the stakeholder representatives have been appointed.

states.name: Involved
states.description: The stakeholder representatives are actively involved in the work and fulfilling their responsibilities.

states.name: In Agreement
states.description: The stakeholder representatives are in agreement.

states.name: Satisfied for Deployment
states.description: The minimal expectations of the stakeholder representatives have been achieved.

states.name: Satisfied in Use
states.description: The system has met or exceeds the minimal stakeholder expectations.

alphas.name: Opportunity
alphas.description: The set of circumstances that makes it appropriate to develop or change a software system. The opportunity articulates the reason for the creation of the new, or changed, software system. It represents the team’s shared understanding of the stakeholders’ needs, and helps shape the requirements for the new software system by providing justification for its development.

workProducts.name: Product Vision
workProducts.description: Communicates what is ultimately wanted or needed from the product, as well as how value will be progressively realized.

states.name: Identified
states.description: A commercial, social or business opportunity has been identified that could be addressed by a software-based solution.
checklists: At least one investing stakeholder interested

states.name: Solution Needed
states.description: The need for a software-based solution has been confirmed.

states.name: Value Established
states.description: The value of a successful solution has been established.

states.name: Viable
states.description: It is agreed that a solution can be produced quickly and cheaply enough to successfully address the opportunity.

states.name: Addressed
states.description: A solution has been produced that demonstrably addresses the opportunity.

states.name: Benefit Accrued
states.description: The operational use or sale of the solution is creating tangible benefits.

alphas.name: Requirements
alphas.description: What the software system must do to address the opportunity and satisfy the stakeholders.

states.name: Conceived
states.description: The need for a new system has been agreed.
checklists: Stakeholders agree system is to be produced

states.name: Bounded
states.description: The purpose and theme of the new system are clear.

states.name: Coherent
states.description: The requirements provide a coherent description of the essential characteristics of the new system.
checklists: Team knows & agrees on what to deliver

states.name: Acceptable
states.description: The requirements describe a system that is acceptable to the stakeholders.

states.name: Addressed
states.description: Enough of the requirements have been addressed to satisfy the need for a new system in a way that is acceptable to the stakeholders.

states.name: Fulfilled
states.description: The requirements that have been addressed fully satisfy the need for a new system.

alphas.name: Software System
alphas.description: A system made up of software, hardware, and data that provides its primary value by the execution of the software.

states.name: Architecture Selected
states.description: An architecture has been selected that addresses the key technical risks and any applicable organizational constraints.

states.name: Demonstrable
states.description: An executable version of the system is available that demonstrates the architecture is fit for purpose and supports functional and non-functional testing.

states.name: Usable
states.description: The system is usable and demonstrates all of the quality characteristics of an operational system.

states.name: Ready
states.description: The system (as a whole) has been accepted for deployment in a live environment.

states.name: Operational
states.description: The system is in use in an operational environment.

states.name: Retired
states.description: The system is no longer supported.

competencies.name: Stakeholder Representation
competencies.description: The ability to gather, communicate and balance the needs of other stakeholders, and accurately represent their views. The stakeholder representation competency is the empathic ability to stand in for and accurately reflect the opinions, rights and obligations of other stakeholders.

levels.name: Assists
levels.description: Demonstrates a basic understanding of the concepts and can follow instructions.

levels.name: Applies
levels.description: Able to apply the concepts in simple contexts by routinely applying the experience gained so far.

levels.name: Masters
levels.description: Able to apply the concepts in most contexts and has the experience to work without supervision.

levels.name: Adapts
levels.description: Able to apply judgment on when and how to apply the concepts to more complex contexts. Can enable others to apply the concepts.

levels.name: Innovates
levels.description: A recognized expert, able to extend the concepts to new contexts and inspire others.

competencies.name: Analysis
competencies.description: The ability to understand opportunities and their related stakeholder needs, and transform them into an agreed and consistent set of requirements. The analysis competency is the deductive ability to understand the situation, context, concepts and problems, identify appropriate high-level solutions, and evaluate and draw conclusions by applying logical thinking.

competencies.name: Development
competencies.description: The ability to design and program effective software systems following the standards and norms agreed by the team. The development competency is the mental ability to conceive and produce a software system, or one of its elements, for a specific function or end. It enables a team to produce software systems that meet the requirements.

competencies.description: The ability to test a system, verifying that it is usable and that it meets the requirements. The testing competency is an observational, comparative, detective and destructive ability that enables the system to be tested.

patterns.name: Customer Engagement
patterns.description: Customer Engagement patterns focus on the interface between the solution development endeavor and the customer space, such as roles and responsibilities. Apply customer engagement patterns to ensure: The “voice of the customer” drives solution priorities, End-user expertise is collaboratively engaged to help develop the solution, All key stakeholder representatives are actively and appropriately engaged.

patterns.name: Product Ownership
patterns.description: A single point of ownership for a product that provides rapid, empowered decisions and dispute arbitration regarding what should be built into the product. Having one person play this role (the “Product Owner”) provides the responsiveness needed for agile delivery, but this person must be able to represent all stakeholders and will need support from others in the team.
